alert.note: Alert for Adair; Allen; Barren; Cumberland; Metcalfe; Monroe (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 14 at 8:36AM EDT by NWS Louisville
info.description: ...STRONG THUNDERSTORMS WILL IMPACT MONROE...SOUTHERN ALLEN... NORTHERN CUMBERLAND...SOUTHERN BARREN...SOUTHWESTERN ADAIR AND METCALFE COUNTIES THROUGH 815 AM CDT... At 735 AM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a cluster of strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 8 miles east of Scottsville to 8 miles south of Portland. Movement was northeast at 45 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph and heavy rainfall. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Scottsville, Tompkinsville, Edmonton, Leslie, Gamaliel, Fountain Run, Cundiff, Curtis, Gum Tree and Harlan Crossroads. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.

area.areaDesc: Adair; Allen; Barren; Cumberland; Metcalfe; Monroe
